Median costs of appendectomies at three different types of North Carolina

Format

A data frame with 59 observations on the following 5 variables.

Cost
a numeric vector
Region
a numeric vector
Rural
a numeric vector
Regional
a numeric vector
Metropol
a numeric vector
======= A data frame with 59 observations on the following two variables.
cost
median costs of appendectomies at hospitals across the state of North Carolina in 1992
region
a numeric vector classifying each hospital (1 = rural), (2 = regional), (3 = metropolitan)

Appendec

Data for Exercise 10.60

str(Appendec) <<<<<<< HEAD attach(Appendec) boxplot(Cost~Region) anova(lm(Cost~as.factor(Region))) detach(Appendec)

======= Appendec$regionc <- ifelse(Appendec$region == 1, "rural", ifelse(Appendec$region == 2, "regional", "metropolitan")) boxplot(cost ~ regionc, data = Appendec, col = c("red", "blue", "cyan")) anova(lm(cost ~ as.factor(regionc), data = Appendec))

Kitchens, L. J. (2003) Basic Statistics and Data Analysis. Duxbury >>>>>>> 832da852208a5c5dc5d4420208e4ca0f661b9051
